sect1.title: Example use of tags
sect1.para: These are the basic rules to follow to use docbook tags. This document is called DocBookExamples.xml, you may find it with the other files in the 'doc-files' directory

sect2.title: Summary of the useful tags
sect2.para: The main tags/structures you should be using are:

listitem.para: <example> when you want an example with a title (should contain a <screen> or <programlisting>)
<itemizedlist> fooloowed by several <listitem> when you want bullets
<link> when you want to refernce another section/chapter/part
<ulink> when you want to reference a web url

para.emphasis: BUT, you should always be using the XXE icons. They have all you need (except for EXAMPLE/SCREEN)! You can also cut n paste!

sect2.title: Code
sect2.para: Code sources can be written between SCREEN tags. You can also use the EXAMPLE TAG around that, to give a title, and be referenced in the table of examples. Watch out, spaces count!
sect2.screen: TinyHello tiny = (TinyHello) ProActive.newActive( TinyHello.class.getName(), // the class to deploy null // the arguments to pass to the constructor, here none ); // which jvm should be used to hold the Active Object
sect2.para: But you can also just use the LITERAL tag to highlight the main methods.
